comment: Frustrating teacher to have. Very vague with her directions. Takes forever to grade a paper, so you have even less time to know what she wants from a paper. Expects to have complex group projects in an online class. Just don't take this class. Find someone else. Find someone better.
Worst professor Ive had at Kennesaw. Doesnt know how to work D2L and makes her students pay for it. Vague and disrespectful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Very judgmental and has no respect for her students. She is elderly and like Trump says whatever comes to mind. During my colligate experience (3 years) she is the only proffessor I have felt disrepected by. I would not advise taking her course.

I took this class during the summer. Its true, if you're a Com major, this will be the hardest class you ever take. The reading is unrealistically long, the notes/quizzes are unclear, but she's quick to answer emails. can be very unclear about what she's looking for on the final paper.I wouldn't take this class under Womack.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Vague directions, uber-critical grading expectations, counts off for every single grammer error. Very slow in grading papers and postings. Quick to respond to emails, but seems somewhat unorganized with class structure and grading guidelines.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Great professor! Cares about her students & adds a personal touch to the class. Class is group paper based
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Womack is literally one of the most intelligent Professors I have ever had the honor of taking here at KSU. She engages the class, and makes sure that we are helped because she does care. I emailed her and got an immediate response. There will obviously be bias people based on the grade they received. Show up. Read. Participate  A.

Professor Womack is one of the best professors at KSU. She is tough, but if you go to class, do your work, then you should have no problems passing. All it takes is a bit of effort and actually studying.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This teacher is the WORST. Do not take her under any circumstances. She is so old she should be retired and does not teach. All she does is talk about her kids and then leave us to try and figure out her extremely unorganized curriculum. Worst teacher I've ever had.

You will need the textbook for the chapter quizzes each week and for the exam. Use her practice quizzes for the exams, because most of the questions will be on the exam.  She is a tough grader on papers, so visit the writing center before turning it in.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: You need perfect grammar skills and a bunch of free time to study if you would like an A. Her tests are tough, but the hardest part are the Annotated Bibliographies. She takes off for every little grammar error. Those are worth 30% of your grade (Not many make an A and most make  Cs). Study the practice quizzes and ready the chapters over and over.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: You have 6 unexcused absences. However everything is posted online. All she does is tell unrelated stories during class, does not review a lot, and the tests are hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The group project was a nightmare. Tests are tough. Make sure to answer the questions on her study guide thoroughly! She's a tough grader on essays. If you're not a good writer; be extra careful when writing your essay. As a teacher, she's very kind and willing to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Womack was one of the hardest graders I've had in my 4 years at KSU. She makes up her own tests/quizzes and they were super hard. We had a group paper that was a nightmare in itself, and her directions for everything were terribly unclear. I had to email her directly almost weekly to get better instructions. She can't use D2L at all.

She expects you to have perfect grammar skills. Is not very clear on what she expects from you on her case study. Absolutely NO interaction with students throughout the class. Get ready to read the textbook like its your job. Her quiz questions are a combination of the text and her power points. Avoid if possible.

Your main grade is a research paper which she expects you to have absolutely no errors on. It took her the entire semester to grade our discussions including the intro. The quizzes were kinda easy and the tests were pretty much the quizzes all formed together kinda difficult. I would take her again if I had to but she wouldn't be my 1st pick. Low B

Took as hybrid. Nice lady but shes unorganized & tends to be unclear w/ instructions. She doesn't really know how to use D2L &  isn't really tech savy which is frustrating. She just tells personal stories the whole class. Bring your laptop or phone cause it can get very boring. Easy A if you take all the quizzes on time & do the discussion posts.

She provides PowerPoints, but I advise you use it as a guide and read the book. One time I made the mistake of only studying her PowerPoints and I failed her quiz. She provides practice quizzes, prior to the actual quiz. do them! it will help you with the quizzes. Tests are tough, but it's  possible to do well if you study.

Teaching style is high school level; She taught 9th grade English. Shouldn't be teaching hybrid or online classes as she spends 15 mins of each class trying to figure out how D2L works. Refers to every PC as an "IBM". Her examples over-complicate. Easy quizzes and tests. Literature review paper can't be done at your own pace.

I have taken Dr.Womack for multiple classes. I LOVE her. She single handedly is responsible for my above average knowledge of AP style. She went above and beyond to help me graduate and all her classes I have gotten an A in. Study her power points, read the book, and practice her online jeopardy game and you will do well.

Hybrid course, summer 8 weeks long. PPT slides from the book (Ting Toomey) Final paper was easy if you kept up with guidelines, which helped build the paper one step at a time. I took very little notes. Keep up with discussions,online quiz, and go to class. Gao's class requires a huge project and paper. Take Womack if you can, easy A.

Don't waste your time with this Proffessor. She's a nice lady but the interest in this class is very low. She really dosen't grab your attention. YOU MUST READ THE BOOK that she helped write, to pass every test. I recommend a different Proffessor if possible.

Enjoyed her Theory class!  Excellent professor!  She is who I desire my professors to model themselves after for a college course.  She provides both a lecture and discussion. The content is based on her book for the class.  She is very knowledgeable and helpful.  Her test are somewhat difficult (like it should be) and the paper was a challenge (li

Very disorganized, however I think she recognizes this about herself and makes several amendments to the assignments during the course of the class, once she realizes there's no time left to complete things. Hard to understand because of the lack of organization.

She is quite possibly the worst professor I've had in college. She asks questions you will not know the answers to, she has the "I'm never wrong" mentality, and takes the subject matter way too seriously. You'll have about 14 quizes, 3 papers (Must use Turnitin), and 3 tests. The worst class I've taken in my college career.

She is a complete waste of time. She does not teach. Treats her students like they are in High School. Makes you read, read, read pointless stuff because she is too lazy to teach. Her quizzes have questions you cant even find in the reading. She really just makes you annoyed that you even signed up for her class. Dont take, unless you NEED too !!!!

VERY SWEET TEACHER! I loved Dr. Womack's class. There are online quizzes you have to do before every class that are not hard as long as you read and you can take it twice using your best grade. Use the quizzes and jeopardy as the study guide for her tests and you'll do fine. I mainly used the book for quizzes but that's it. I would recommend attend
shes older but very helpful and sweet

Wonderful teacher.  Expects a lot from students (that is a GOOD thing).  You must study and attend classes to do well.  You will learn how to write at the college level.  Very fair, nice woman who is always available for help or advice.  She helped me apply to graduate schools and her advice and mentoring were invaluable.

I had her when she taught at Stonehill and I think she is a wonderful prof.  She is very fair, if you ask her for help she will do all she can to help you. But, she does expect you to do your work...she is not an easy A but I learned a lot from her class.  She is a genuinely nice person also.

very picky and picks favorites. She's been published before and isn't afraid to tell you. If your writing style isn't EXACTLY like hers, she'll make you do your paper all over again. My advice: don't take her class.
